body:
Comment 2: 
This is pretty unlikely to change, because it would give subtly
different meaning to go f(g) and go { f(g) }.  Requiring the func
makes it clear when the different variables are evaluated.

http://groups.google.com/group/golang-nuts/browse_frm/thread/1a4cc81453bb7a93
_Owner changed to **r...@golang.org**._ _Status changed to **WontFix**._
